it.uniroma1.lcl.mynn

Class Neuron

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma1.lcl.mynn.Neuron

  • public class Neuron
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a Neuron, the basic element of a neural network. The neuron has a variable channel inputs, for each input there is an associated weight and each neuron is able to produce an output in according with a formula requested by the layer. For the morphology of a neuron and its properties see MyNN documentation.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nunzio Castelli

      • Neuron

        public Neuron(double[] inputs,
              double[] weights)
        Create the neuron object
        Parameters:
        inputs - number of channel inputs.
        weights - weights associated to the inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • setWeights

        public void setWeights(double[] weigths)
        Set the weights for the current Neuron object. The previously values will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        weigths - the new values.

      • setBfactor

        public void setBfactor(double bFactor,
                       int weigthIndex)
        Set the partial derivate value in according to the documentation. This value is used during the upgrading function for the weigths into the multi layer network. Each channel has a bFactor value.
        Parameters:
        weigthIndex -
        bFactor - partial derivate value

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(double weigth,
                      int i)
        Set a weight valye for the current Neuron object.
        Parameters:
        weigth - value
        i - channel index

      • getBfactor

        public double getBfactor(int weigthIndex)
        Retrieve the partial derivate value calculated previously. This method is usefull during the upgrading function for the weigths into the multi layer network. Each channel has a bFactor value.
        Parameters:
        weigthIndex -
        Returns:
        the stored bFactor

      • setThreshold

        public void setThreshold(double threshold)
        Set the threshold for the current Neuron object. The old value will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the new value.

      • transferFunction

        public double transferFunction(double[] inputsValues)
                        throws ActivateFunctionException
        Calculate and store the transfer function value. The transfer function is the balanced sum of all channel inputs for the associated weights value, example: transferFunction = E(Input-i * Weigth-i)
        Parameters:
        inputsValues - neuron inputs,
        Returns:
        transfer function value.
        Throws:
        ActivateFunctionException

        Returns:
        output.
